frame.name: Individual_history
frame.definition:
<def-root>This scenario describes a series of Events, associated a single Participant, i.e., the history of the Participant. The Events do not necessarily form a coherent whole (e.g., are not necessarily causally related), but merely occupy a period of time. In many cases the history is limited to what are considered the important or significant events. Words in this frame can also denote the time period over which the sequence of Events took place.
Note: uses of words in this frame to describe a record of the series of events are not in this frame (e.g., <ment>we compiled a history of Rome</ment>).
<ex>We've been worried about <fex name="Participant">our recent hire's</fex> <t><fex name="Events">history</fex></t> <fex name="Domain">of deceiving employers</fex>.</ex>
<ex>The following sections document the entire <fex name="tim">25-year</fex> <t><fex name="Events">history</fex></t> <fex name="Participant">of the company</fex>.</ex>
<ex>Our areas of strength are <fex name="Participant">British, American and European</fex> <t><fex name="Events">History</fex></t> <fex name="Start_time">from 1492</fex> <fex name="End_time">to 2000</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Participant
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Participant</fen> is either an active participant in all of the <fen>Events</fen> (e.g., Agent or Patient), or is more peripherally associated with the <fen>Events</fen> (e.g., Location or Topic).
<ex>We've been worried about <fex name="par">our recent hire's</fex> <t>history</t> of deceiving employers.</ex>
<ex>I was charmed, and also determined to learn more about <fex name="par">the factory's</fex> <t>history</t>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Events
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Events</fen> which the <fen>Participant</fen> is a part of. This FE is used to mark the frame-evoking element.
<ex>We will focus on events in her recent <t><fex name="eve">history</fex></t>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Domain
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Domain</fen> is (a characterization of) the type of event that is to be included in consideration of the <fen>Participant</fen>'s history.
<ex>One of my colleagues is an expert on the <fex name="dom">economic</fex> <t>history</t> of the Hellenistic period</ex>
<ex>The Netherlands' long <t>history</t> <fex name="dom">of trade with China</fex> provides important information for modern political economies.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: End_time
FE.definition:
<def-root>The end of the span of time during which the <fen>Events</fen> occur.
<ex>This article discusses mainly the geography and the <t>history</t> of Palestine <fex name="end">until the United Nations took up the Palestine problem in 1947</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Start_time
FE.definition:
<def-root>The beginning of the time span over which the <fen>Events</fen> occur.
<ex>The introduction describes the history of geography <fex name="sta">from the eighteenth century onwards</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Time_span
FE.definition:
<def-root>The span of time over which the <fen>Events</fen> take place.
<ex>We have traced the flag?s <t>past</t> <fex name="tim">between its original conception in the 14th century and its end a hundred years later</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Duration
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Duration</fen>, often expressed in calendric units, of the history of the <fen>Participant</fen>.
<ex>The following sections document the entire <fex name="dur">25-year</fex> <t>history</t> of the company.</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: history.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the whole series of past events connected with someone or something.

lexUnit.name: past.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a person's or thing's history or earlier life.
